text: Robin Fulton (born 6 May 1937 on the Isle of Arran), is a Scottish poet and translator. ==Biography== He has lived in Stavanger, Norway, since 1973 working as a university lecturer. Fulton gained a PhD in Scottish literature from the University of Edinburgh in 1972. He has published his own collections and several translations of Scandinavian poetry into English, including Olav H. Hauge, Tomas Tranströmer and Henrik Nordbrandt. ==References== == External links == * Robin Fulton | Poems in poetenladen (poet-shop), english-german * Peter Macdonald's review of A NORTHERN HABITAT: COLLECTED POEMS 1960-2010 - featured in Rain Taxi Category:1937 births Category:Living people Category:Scottish poets Category:Alumni of the University of Edinburgh
